caption: Large drink menu is nice. Otherwise the food is really nothing much to speak of and the server was pretty inattentive. Give the food runner a raise; he was the one doing all the work.

By far one of the best places I’ve had brunch, service was amazing, staff were super friendly and respectful, food came out so quick and tasted so good. I will definitely visit them whenever I’m in DC.

Wonderful belgian restaurant with beautifully presented dishes. I've been here plenty of times. The lobster waffle, Brussels mussels, bitterballen,  and Rabbit are some of my favorites! The desserts are excellent as well.

On Our Valentines day we decide to have a brunch at Belga cafe. And didn’t regret at all! The hostess was great - very friendly, positive and welcoming. We ordered waffle and mussels. Yum! Nothing to add or take. Irish coffee and Bloody Mary were also good! Also want to mention that during COVID and cold weather it’s hard to find a place where you could feel secure enough to sit without masks and eat. In Belga cafe they found a good solution with tents and heaters. All in all, I recommend!
Very good .  please add 2 more slices of french toast at that same price.
Great service and menu options. I definitely will be going back.
They have okay drink and food. I wasn't expecting them to blow my mind but they were a bit bland to be honest. They have a great selection of rum at the bar though. Fun vibe overall.
We really had a great time, service was great, food was great, owners where there on site. Big fan will be back.
Excellent food and service. Beautiful indoor and outdoor seating.

Planning to go to different restaurant for Restaurant week, but the beautiful ambiance at this restaurant drew us in...  it was such a lovely surprise...the presentation of the food was superb,  not to mention the mouth watering and tender meat entrées.  Great music, quaint atmosphere, friendly management... Was a lovely intimate evening.
Great food, excellent service and awesome Covid-19 accommodations

This place was great for brunch. Our server was very kind and helpful and funny. I usually don't leave reviews places, but the experience was so good that I wanted to. A great place. Will definitely return!
Bacon truffle Bloody Mary with celery foam was unique and delicious. Shame they don’t have better brunch specials, probably would have stuck around for more.
Best brunch I've had in a while.
The scenery was comforting and jolly!!
Best brunch on 8th Street in Capitol Hill. Superb service. Staff is very customer service oriented. Food is divine taste. Belga Café is chasing a michellein star 🌟.
Great food and excellent service.

The food was great, but service not so great. I asked the waiter for creamer when he brought me a black coffee and he made it seem like an inconvenience to him, he also never refilled our water at all. When the bill came they automatically put a 20% tip.. no wonder it’s bad service, they know they’ll get 20% on an overpriced meal no matter what.

My daughter picked up our Thanksgiving meal for Two. I will never cook this Turkey day meal again. The meal was outstanding. Added benefit was that I could add money to my order to help the local community with their dinner.  Wish I had the recipe for the stuffed parsnips!?!?Yes parsnips. They were fantastic.  Thank you Bella Cafe.

We haven’t been to cafe in quit sometime. Due to outside hut and location convenience we decided to revisit. The hut was amazing. Food was superb. Waiters fantastic. Appetizers; escargot, tartar with salad and the bread basket. Main meal; stew, apple slaw and frites, good size veal chop with mashed potatoes topped with roasted brussel sprouts, waffle with black berries strawberry and sorbet. Excellent.
Almost worth going to entirely for the car parking space. It's an extremely luxurious and well built up parking lot, I was impressed. Food was meh.
If you're an international beer connoisseur, highly recommend
Everything was great!!! We loved our waiter! NERIS WAS AMAZING!!!!!!
DO NOT GET THE CODDLED EGG IN THE BOKAAL... unless you want bland mashed potatoes for 15 dollars. Not what I was expecting.
Nice outdoor seating, great beer selection!
Love this restaurant!
Incredible food and service. Loved it. Had a beautiful time and we got to sit outside in the green houses. Highly recommend. If you’re in DC only for a short time, be sure to make a trip here.

*Review adjusted after restaurant response*  Good food, questionable service.  Don’t recommend.  After being greeted and seated, we ordered drinks.  Ten minutes later, no drinks.  When the drinks arrived, they tasted fine.  We ordered our meals, which arrived in a reasonable amount of time.   Halfway through the meal, someone finally checked on us.  Food tasted fine - so no complaints, but it was a little late to check.  At the end of the meal, I wanted some bread for the table.  I had to flag down a waiter that wasn’t my own to obtain it, but when the bread arrived it tasted fine (though it did cost $5, which struck me as odd).  Finally, the check arrived.  It contained a cocktail we didn’t order.  We sent it back to be reworked. When the manager returned with the new check, she asked how we liked the food.  I responded, “Fine.”  She then aggressively replied that she was sorry I hadn’t brought my dissatisfaction to her attention “all those times [she] stopped by the table” (despite the fact she didn’t do that at all).  So, it’s fair to say the food was actually pretty decent (honestly, it was).  But, we had a very questionable service experience and I can’t recommend this restaurant for a relaxing brunch.  Edit:  We now understand that the 20% gratuity is automatically included, which we accept and have edited our review to reflect this fact (to include adding a star).  But, honestly, the service still didn’t warrant anywhere near that good of a tip and our refusal to return stands.  Past a certain point, tips, like repeat business, are earned.   Good luck and I hope my experience was unique.
I love this place! So good. Everything, always! this is a picture of the monkfish and the lamb shoulder both super yummy. 🤤
Great ambience, gluten free dubbel beer, and out of this world food.

First time trying this place out and it was....interesting. It is SPENDY. An omelette is $22?!? The portions are veryyy small for the price but the food was decent. The cinnamon waffle was yummy and the salmon eggs Benedict was pretty good. I really thought I would be blown away by the doffle but it was ~meh~. Don’t bother with a reservation because they don’t really use them? We had a 12:30 and we’re told to check the restaurant behind the building with the same menu to see if they had seating instead? It was quite bizarre. Overall the staff was kind and the food was ok but wow is it spendy.
Courteous and efficient staff, Sumptuous meal too. I'm definitely coming back. Parking can be hell but the food is worth it.

Lovely setting , drinks, and great  environment. The food wasnt the best , just may have been my plate but i tried the lamb and it was dry,tuff, and room temperature. So that ruin the rest of the evening. But i wont give up on the restaurant just yet , have to try again another day.

Today was the first time I visit Belga Cafe. Food was amazing! As a Dutchie I cannot describe how excited I am that I discovered this place and the food they serve here. The Steak Tartare is the best I have had in Washington. The 'kaas kroketten' are good to. (Deep fried cheese croquet).love that the menu is partially in Dutch. I will definitely be back! Goed gedaan Belga Cafe!

It's simple. For the very best, and most genuine form of Belgium cooking... You must go to Belga Cafe.  This has been my favorite location for the past 6 years.  The food is balanced, perfectly matched, and healthy.  The service is always 5 star.

Nice place for brunch on Capitol Hill. Outside street dining is set up nice and service was on top of everything and friendly. Cowboy Hash Brown Skillet was a lot mixed in from hash browns, beer-braised short ribs, Brussels sprouts, chipotle ketchup, pickled onions, scrambled egg. Definitely a nice place to grab a relaxing meal.
Always lovely...Food, staff, atmosphere. And Bravo to the restaurant for doing such a great job creating an elegant, safe, social distancing dining experience.
Great food.
Very good food
A pleasant place for Sunday brunch. Attentive service and good food, but nothing outstanding.

Great place, loved brunch. Service staff was very friendly, they all helped each-other out and created very timely service. Would recommend 10/10. Such a fancy experience. Victoria was great and we highly recommend her. She was super sweet and got everything out so timely.
Great food
Wow. Went for Sunday brunch and was blown away by how good the food was. Portion size wasn't crazy like most restaurants are but just enough to fill me up. Will definitely be back again.

Great service, great food . One of our favorite dishes had been  suspended but they went out of their way to make it for us. Any place else would have said sorry, but they were very happy to accommodate us. Thanks to the staff and manager. We'll be back.

It was my first time eating at Belga Cafe.  It made me think of what it would be like to sit outside at a little French cafe. It was DC restaurant week and they had the the most delightful menu. Everything was delicious.  I would definitely dine there again. The service was magnificent. The servers never passed by the table without asking if we needed anything else.  A must try. Take public transportation, even in a pandemic parking was a premium.
Love this spot
I had their lunch, and it was seriously the best Western European cuisine I had in United States in 3 years

The brunch was solid, but not amazing. We got the chicken and waffles, the Liege waffles bites, and bacon. Everything was good, but we've had better takes on everything. The waffle bites would have been better as a whole waffle, the bacon could be thicker, and the chicken and waffles could have been more unique or creative. But again, not a disappointment, and a decent place to go for a waffle fix. Being a Belgian beer fan, their selection was pretty lackluster, so we didn't bother.
The worst waffle I’ve ever tried it was like in the refrig for along time and they heated

Updated based on 4/24/20 experience: Thank you Belga Cafe for my modified low FODMAP dinner for our first date anniversary! Great pick up experience too!  *******  So good! One of our favorite reataurants. Treated us well for our anniversary. Try the BBQ pork belly waffle appetizer. Yummy!
Great spot.  Belgium omelet was great and I loved dessert.  Too bad there was no more Belgium hot chocolate...
Great atmosphere. Great food. Great service
Best brunch I've had in DC in a long time!
Amazing brunch.  One of our favorite brunch destinations!
friendly staff, excellent food and presentation
Food was amazing and the beer selection... just as amazing.
Great waffles, and great fries.
This place is awesome.
The food was very good. Beware they don’t have cream for coffee, only whole milk or almond milk which costs extra.
Great food and service
Waffles were cool the were tasty and prepared well but kind of pricey for me.   Now, I'm from the midwest so everything in the DMV is pricey to me.

Friends made a reservation for a  party of 20 here, we were cramped in a corner by the kitchen, they had restrictions on splitting the check, and the food was ok at best. My son's waffles were dry, my hashbrown waffles were dry, my husband never got the drink he ordered... Wouldn't recommend.

The food was delicious - it was definitely homemade and from well-known Belgian and Dutch recipes. The menu was partly in Dutch but had English translation in the description if you don't speak Dutch. Their beer menu was extensive and we appreciated their expertise on the subject. A great dining experience!
Good selection of Belgian beer and food BUT the beers are overpriced and the food is a bit inconsistent I.e. mussel pots
This place is run with passion for service. Great selection of Belgian dishes and beers! Being a Belgian, i can say this with confidence.
I've been for dinner before and it's great, but this post is about brunch. Wonderful! Different menu than the regular stuff. Definitely try it!
Belga Cafe is alawys a great dining experience.

A must visit! Especially for brunch! Their bowls and the Smoked Samon were delicious. Their coffee is really good and so as their hot chocolate. I definitely plan to come back to check out their other meals.
Great service by friendly staff. Excellent food and amazing selection of Belgian beers.
Elegant atmosphere, great for gentle conversations. The food is exquisitely prepared. Try their mussels.

I rate places according to ambiance, service, time, and the tasty food. Belga cafe has a great ambiance (5). I would describe this place as cozy. The service as Belga cafe is ok. The day we went the hostess was a little crass. The waiter was just there to do her job but not really there to have a great interaction with the customers. They did have our order correct and remembered who all the food and drinks went to (3). We were seating at the time of our reservation and the food and drinks come in a timely manner (5). The food at Belga cafe is presented very well and also taste great!! The food is very fresh!! Besides the waffles I also wanted some Hash Waffled. The hash waffles were ok. They were slightly doughy and raw on the inside. The favors were great though! (4)
Good service and tasty food, small portions for the the prices though
Food and selection were fine, but nowhere near worth the price.
Great onion soup! Dessert was very good. Main courses were good but not great and it's pricey, but very attentive service on a Saturday night. Still a solid choice for dinner on 8th St./Barracks Row.
The menu here is phenomenal and there is pretty much nothing I wouldn't eat on it! Grab lunch here to avoid the crowds.

Mussels are quite tiny, i guess is because it’s not the season, food is a bit salty so need to drink a lot of water, BUT hard to get the waiter even he is around because hard to get attention from him! Very thirsty after having this pot. The waitress service is better than the waiter.

Really delicious! Lived in Germany for 5 years with frequent visits to its neighbor, Belgium. The pommes frites (french fries) with mayo remind me of my time overseas and are so good! The waffles are also delicious! I've been here three times for brunch and would definitely recommend this place.
A taste of Belgium in the heart of DC. The food was well prepared and presented, service was quick and friendly, and the atmosphere relaxed. The prices are eyebrow raising, then again we are in DC.
Great waffles, including a GF option. Great atmosphere, but the tables are packed in like sardines and a hot water with a single tea bag is $5
great mussels; beautiful restaurant

Wow! Nice atmosphere, great service, excellent food and the prices are not too bad. I had the halibut, came with a medley of grapes, spinach, scallions, squash, broccoli, peas, snow peas, brussels sprouts...all cooked to perfection. We also had an appetizer that pretty much looked like a chicken egg roll, it was delicious! I would definitely go back, and have the mussels next time!
Delicious brunch! Good spot.  Not cheap, but good.
Great service and delicious food!
Small portions expensive it's ok
username: Armando's Auto Detailing LLC AKA Rocky

caption: Staff was nice. Food was lackluster and portions small for the price. I expected more for the area they are in.
Best waffles in DC
Food was great, awesome environment.  Fried brussel sprouts!
Wonderful place for brunch.

I walked by this place just about every day going to work and I always am going to try this so today was a day I am not sure what the origin of this restaurant is what I want to say more of a Spanish I ordered an omelette and had calamari lobster crab with a son of a sauce on the outside and a small green salad it was very tasty but I think it really known for their waffles they have all sorts of Belgium waffles thinking of it as light desserts waffles with strawberries and blueberries and whipped cream topping I'm going to try that next Sophia in Eastern Market area check the spot out and tell me what you think
Second time here, and everything is literally great: location, food, and most importantly the wonderful staff, in particular, Big thanks to Sergei, top level service.
Great food and ambiance, definitely feels like Key West.
Great food. Not very fast but good enough.
The only thing that makes great food taste better is awesome service. This place was amazing from begining to end.
Such a great date night restaurant.
Love the food, especially the waffles.
Excellent

This place was great. Had a great waffle brunch here with a refreshing drink. The staff were kind and prompt but not hovering which was nice. I would recommend this place for a great brunch in a spot that you can feel comfortable in.

Went for the leige waffles and we were extremely disappointed. We got the entre leige waffle and the waffle bites and neither were good. Was hoping for the same taste as the leige waffles I had in Belgium and was so let down. Their strawberry brussels waffle was good though and the service was good. Wouldn't come back again though
Best mussles ever.
Nice beer selections. Not to crowded.

My friend (whose hubby is Belgian and lived there for 7 years) and I could not say enough great things about Belga Cafe!  We had lunch there last week, sharing the chilled gazpacho, large (very!) order of moules frites mariniere, and a never-ending half bottle of Sancerre!  Everything from the crusty bread to the perfectly done fries and flavorful mussels was spot on.  Sergey, our server, took great care of us.  This will be a must-go stop next time in DC.  Merci et bravo!
The presentation was great and food was even better!
Great food bad coffee
Fancy Belgian food. Good place for a special occasion or date night.
Great waffle brunch
Excellent Belgium waffles service was great, weather was also great to sit outside

My friends and I had a delicious meal at Belga Cafe!! We all got seafood and it was fresh and flavorful. My scallops were cooked to perfection, though personally I could have done without the turnips. Try the mussels with curry!! Afterwards we went up to the rooftop bar owned by the same folks and had a yummy spritzer. 10/10 would recommend.
Excellent tasty food, great service and, sure the best beer you could find. Highly recommend
I'm not really sure what they do to  their eggs but wow! Try in the summer when the terrace is open, beautiful.
Great food but the service is a bit slow
Excellent drinks/food. However, double check your receipts at Betsy - they double charged my friends and I.

We went for dinner.  They have a nice patio out front for outside dining.  The inside was quite and intimate.  We both ordered mussels and they were very fresh and the portion was plentiful.  Though the frites that came with them were on the soggy side.  The sauce with the Mussels "Ostendaise" was very flavorful and clean tasting.  My companion thought the Mussels "Garlic Butter" was a bit on the bland side. The wait staff was a little slow in coming around to check on us and refill drinks.  Which seemed odd since it was a pretty slow night and there were so many of them.  If you happen to be going to the Marine Barracks, it's right down the street.
Great mussels dishes.
Excellent food and service
Great food and friendly staff.  Mussels are to die for.
Great service! Very personable and very attentive waiter.

The owner was so great with service! He allowed our group of 30 people to stand in the restaurant during a strong rain storm. He even personally helped some in through an additional window entrance. We didn't stay to eat, however, if taste matches service it'd be a great meal!
(Translated by Google) Tasty food and jovial owner but on the more expensive side  (Original) Lekker eten en joviale eigenaar maar wel aan de duurdere kant
This is such a great find! My friend and I went here for brunch, and we both loved what we ordered. Definitely coming back again!
Everything tasted bland, I wasn't impressed.

Excellent food, sexy restaurant, quality service!!!

Very good beer selection. One visit, we had a very good experience with an attentive and friendly waiter. More recently, we had two different waiters who were not paying attention. I got the wrong dish, which cost more, and the waiter never checked on us. I thought it seemed off, but just ploughed through it and was haunted by digestive ghosts all night. They were not busy at all, so I don't know why the waiter never followed up after the food was delivered.
Very rude staff, the food was way over priced and was such a small portion. Food was not enjoyable. Ordered tortellini and literally got 4 for $25

Good food, but they serve very little depending what you get. My friend ordered tortellini and they gave him 4 pieces.see the pictures. They steak was asked medium well they brought it medium rare. They gave steak with a salad, nothing else. They did not want to give us more bread but then brought a different bread that was hard and kind of burnt. They almost forgot the fries and had to remind him 3 times. They prices should $$ it was more like $$$. Very pricy. The server had a bad attitude and was not very nice. I personally would not come here again. But I do recommend it if it is your type of place. 2 stars they get from me. They lost 3 because of price, service, and food quantity.
Interesting food freshly made. Server was a bit pushy on getting our order in. I guess one shouldn’t linger during the brunch rush. Understandable.
Loved it!  Went today and very much enjoyed our food.
Great spot for dinner for a date, business, or with friends. Belgian classics, executed well.
Delicious food but a little pricey.

Excellent service and amazing food. We were a party of 6 on a Sunday night and we had the entire place for us. Despite of the time, the waitress was very nice and kind. From the long list of coursework we ordered everything was excellent.
Great service! Huge selection of wine and beers, plus tons of authentic Belgian dishes.
Really wonderful brunch spot! Everything was delicious and our service was impeccable
The place to go for mussels and Belgian beer!

My friend, Beth, made a reservation for us to go to Belga after the fashion show for DC fashion week. I had been to Belga twice before really liked it a lot so was very pleased to go again. My 3rd visit did not let me down. I do appreciate a small, cozy restaurant much more than cavernous ones. I enjoyed salmon, braised cabbage, potato galette, some French fries with 3 different sauces, a glass of Bordeaux and finished it all up with some dollops of mousse and ice cream. Our food came quickly, with the plates warm - yea, (I really can't stand cold plates with hot food - of course, the dessert plate was not warm),the servers were attentive and pleasant. Happy!
Excellent food, excellent dessert, quiet venue.
Wonderful!!!

My friends and I made brunch reservations at Belga Café for the Sunday of President’s Day weekend.  I was five minutes late because of the Metro, but the friendly accommodating host found us a table within minutes and we were seated without much trouble.  That was the highlight of the experience.  The restaurant was busy, of course, but we had barely sat down when the waiter appeared asking for our order.  We had had very little time to peruse the menu, and he seemed visibly impatient with questions.  In fact, as I was mid-sentence in asking one he turned his attention completely to the next table.  Somewhat unsurprisingly, when our food did arrive I was served the wrong dish (I had tried to ask about two different waffles, this was the one I thought I had decided against), which I did not have time to communicate, because the person who delivered our food slung it down on the table and vanished again.  I ate what I was served, partially because it was, after all, my runner up, but mostly because I was starving and thought I might not have the opportunity to order anything else.  That instinct proved to be correct.  Our waiter was nowhere to be found until the forks were down and then he magically appeared to clear the dishes and hand over the check in one move.  Our group was still in the middle of a conversation, so we lingered a bit while finishing our drinks, and it was only after the waiter had been stalking by for five minutes (again, AFTER giving us the bill) that he asked if we wanted anything else.  Well, his words were “Did you want anything else?”  His tone said, “Go away now.”  I understand that the restaurant is high traffic for Sunday brunch, but we had had a reservation, and yet I still felt like we were unwelcome annoyances to be suffered and pushed out again as quickly as possible.  The experience was rushed, inhospitable, and discourteous.  Oh, and the waffle I did have?  On the positive side it was light and golden brown, but on the negative it was oddly over-sweet.  The frites were good.  Nothing makes up for the tone of the service though.  I had thought other menu items looked tempting, but I don’t think I’ll be back to Belga Café.
Skip the gym and go there to work on your mussels
The brunch is fantastic
Great food, will be back!
Went for restaurant week. Incredible food

This past Sunday, 1/27/19, my wife made a reservation for 6 at 1:30pm, the reservation was confirmed earlier that day with a phone call from the restaurant.  Upon arrival, the hostess said we'd have to wait to be seated until everyone in …
I was surprised how good the waffles were

Slow inadequate service. Flemmish stew had an overwhelming beer flavor. Visited for lunch during restaurant week. Only one server but also only 3 tables occupied so should have been adequate coverage. Took > 1 hour for meal. A little long for lunch break.
Delicious Belgian-inspired food an  PHENOMENAL beer selection
The food was delicious and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend it!
Waffle was pretty good, especially the whipped cream on top, which is light but creamy. Omelette and hash browns were just okay and a little bit  greasy.
The place to be if you miss Belgian food and BEER!
It was such a pleasure as usual to dinner at your establishment. You made my birthday dinner memorable!
Clean but fish was overcooked and french fries were  very hard to the point it was  hard to eat. Waiting time was a little too long. Overall not too bad.
Delicious mussles and steak tar tar...  Great Belgian beer selection
Good waffles and good brunch food
Great food, and atmosphere
Small portions nicely presented at an expensive price.
Pictures won’t make a justice... delicious! We are here on Christmas Eve, the place is packed but the food was ready within 15 minutes.

Went here to FINALLY try the food and it  was fresh, delicious and well made. My husband LOVED the lambsburger. It was great, could have been thicker and more goat cheese, but still a very good burger. There was so much involved with this burger, but everything made a symphony of flavor! The drink I ordered was a little light, but tasted well. It was slow but the service was delightful. We will definitely be back to try brunch!  Went for brunch on a Saturday. It was tough picking one thing, there were so many wonderful options. I had the bananencake waffle. Could have used more bacon, i didn't really need the chocolate, but it was still delicious. My spouse had the braised short ribs and he really enjoyed his meal. We both had their take on a peach bellini, we will both never order that again.

Sigh. Belga, we have been coming regularly for way over 10 years...our go-to neighborhood spot for happy hours when we need a great cocktail and bar food at the end of a long day and the main place we take our out of town friends and family for the specialty (and regular)dinners. What a relief when you came and we no longer had only Banana Cafe! We have always been able to count on you. But. What in the world happened to the happy hour food menu? No food specials anymore. Just a regular bar menu with some drink specials. As old timers, we will be back but not as frequently! ps. We love Betsy😊
Food was good. little pricey for the mediocre fries and the waffle menu needs to be cleared up .

caption: My wife and I love coming here for brunch Sunday morning! There are so many delicious things to choose from.
Great food! Especially enjoyed the Belgium coffee!

Consistently good Belgian / country French cuisine.
Steak frites and service were perfection!
Wonderful food
Very good food.

The beer list of mostly Belgium, and related beers is great, they have many hard to find brews which is an amazing find in Capitol Hill. I went in the waning hours of brunch after 2 on a Sunday, so service was great and the seating was quick although if you try earlier you should grab a reservation first. I had the steak au poive which was excellent it came with pomme frites all in all a filling meal the steak was beautiful and the sauce was delicious! They also accommodated one in our party that couldn't drink with her own virgin bloody which according to her was so good it didn't need the vodka.
There was a 30 to 45 minute wait and was a lot over priced.
Great food and good service
Didn't have pork sausage or bacon at 11am for brunch.  Are you kidding me? It's brunch that's what we eat.
Lovely brunch.
Loud and but crowded - no vegan options
Good fare as always. I would have liked a little more beef stew.
Absolutely lovely waffles, but still fairly expensive for a waffle...
Nice place, great food, a bit expensive though
Probably my favorite breakfast so far in DC.
Brunch was on point!
Amazing mussels. Discounted onTuesday nights!
Awesome people and place.

The filet mignon is one of the top 2 steaks I have ever had. The beer selection and other offerings are superb. I wasn't quite sure what I wanted to eat tonight.  So as I walked down 8th Street in Souther DC,  I saw the Belga Cafe.  This is a Belgium styled restaurant that serves imported beers, and an excellent filet Mignon. As usual, I ordered the filet rare, and it was charred crisp on the outside with a perfectly cool red center.  No grease or drippings to be found.  The pomme frites (fries) were crisp and golden on the outside, and fluffy on the inside.  The waiter, Nathan, superbly described every beer available.  I started with a bottle wheat beer, and finished with a dark belgium beer with a nutty and sweet finish.  Nathan also came by with a couple of samples of the seasonal beers.  Both were excellent, but I just couldn't drink anymore.  The atmosphere was very warm, with a well maintained interior.  The only odd aspect were box fans leaning from the sealing.  Some styled ceiling fans would be a better choice, but I understand the choice.  Ceiling fans would be $5-10 for purchase and installations.  I don't think most patrons recognize it.  Con: The only downside that I talked with the waiter [Nathan] about was that the salad was served on the heated plate with the filet.  This rendered the salad inedible after a couple of minute.  Overall, Belga Cafe is an excellent choice.  In addition to a strong menu, there are regular deals for returning customers such as large orders of mussels on the weekend.  I will return.

The atmosphere and service were superb. We had a great waiter who was very knowledgeable about the menu. For starters I had the aspereges met krab. Not what I expected, but delicious. It was basically one asparagus stalk cut up and crab meat on the side. For dinner, I tried Le vrai steak frites belge cooked medium. I’m not a true steak connoisseur but I thought it was average. The steak is served with a side salad and fries, which were both also average. For dessert, I had the chocolate mousse which comes with 3 flavors - dark, white and milk chocolate. The presentation was lovely. I favored the dark chocolate. My companion had the Belgium waffle which was really just a sliver of a waffle with strawberries and whip cream. The mussels seemed to be popular at surrounding tables.
Excellent Belgian food!!! Definitely worth a visit.

A lovely Sunday Brunch. The Waffles were delicious. The atmosphere was great. I had the Luikse Wafel and my friend across from me had the Brusselse Wafel. They came with fresh fruit. Sweet and hit the spot.

Hubby and I had a delicious meal for date night. Our server Eduardo was so sweet and very attentive. Highly recommend the butter and garlic mussels. The frites (fries) were deliciously crispy and salted to perfection. My mock-tail was refreshing. And the truffle Mac and cheese was a great addition. Glad we stopped in for dinner.
Love this place so much
Delicious food tho I'd recommend St Arnold's if you're going for mussels and/or beer. Tasty cocktails with pleasant, relaxed service. Beer is overpriced.
Great beer list.

I wish I could post higher reviews, but I guess I just can’t afford the places with exceptional food. Granted, I am foodie with a palate that’s developed past the norm, but it’s the bane of my existence that people give 4 and 5-star reviews to places that simply don’t deserve them. Unless the food is fantastic, I just can’t give an amazing review! I want to be honest, straightforward, and fair to those coming behind me, reading my reviews and looking for great food. If ambiance and/or variety is what floats your boat, there are many, many places in DC that will make you happy! But if you‘re a true foodie, there are few that will..and not break the bank. Belga Cafe, sadly, is not the type of place that warrants you going out of your way for the food. Might there, perhaps, be an item or two on the menu that stand out? Possibly, but my friend and I didn’t have them. So I can’t say I’d come back quickly to explore the menu further. I’m a pretty decent cook, so I can’t justify spending lots of money on “half baked” food. (No pun intended.) What’s the point? I’d rather stay home, spend less money, and eat better. We came for restaurant week, and I was surprised that the app/entree special were for items that didn’t even appear to be on their normal menu. Isn’t the point of restaurant week to show off what you offer on the menu, or did I get something wrong? That said, our food was decent, or I wouldn’t have given a 3-star review. (We had mussels, fries, asparagus/egg salad, seafood pasta, and a sautéed beef dish.) But what most disappointed me, especially for a Belgian place, was the cappuccino and 3-mousse dessert. The latter had three flavors on the plate, and although it’s possible Belgium has a thicker, more dense style of mousse than I’m used to, it just fell short of my expectations, tasted “fridgy” (like its been in the fridge too long or left in there uncovered), and on top of all, was still frozen. All three of them! So sad, when what I had hoped for was that lovely mousse texture and the delight of savoring the distinct three flavors of dark, milk, and white chocolates. The cappuccino was bitter, thin, and the frothy milk had entirely too large bubbles (I’ve been spoiled with micro-bubbles). Nothing a little sugar and a spoon won’t fix, but still, disappointing. Sorry guys, I’m sure there are plenty of people who love coming here for a variety of reasons, but when you’re a real foodie, with so many great options in DC, I just can’t give the food I ate today more than a 3-star review. One highlight was the glass of Grenache/Syrah blend from France I had. It was delish!
Best waffles in southeast! The Brunch Bartender is cute😊
The beef short ribs melt in your mouth
Very quick fast brunch place. I got the quiche and it was pretty yummy. Everyone else got waffles and there were no complaints.
Awesome Brunch

Belga Cafe has a cool vibe with exposed brick walls inside and outdoor seating, but the interior does feel a bit cramped.  The waffles (we tried Liege and had the rosemary waffle with my duck) were tasty, but not overwhelming. I ordered the duck and my friend ordered the chicken with tarragon jus. Both dishes have good flavor but  did have crispy skin. Crispy skin would have made for standout dishes.  My friend and I enjoyed the experience overall and would return (though perhaps wouldn't hurry to do so).

Want a nice brunch? Belgian waffles with some unexpected toppings, perhaps? This is the place. Interesting and good food. (The 'Kaas Wafel Met Kwartel' is an lovely take on chicken and waffles -- with quail!) And, Bloody Mary is served with celery foam. Start your day happy! :-)
One of our favorite places in DC. Well prepared Belgian food in a friendly atmosphere.
One of our favorite places in DC. Well prepared food in a friendly setting. Great Belgian beers.

One of the tastiest Belgian spots in town,  and an integral part of any Eastern Market adventure.  Stop in here first for bloodies and waffles before hiking the market.  Prices moderate,  food tasty, drinks chilly,  and dessert is on point too! Dinner is equally good,  the block is not too lively at night,  and tables not too hard to come by.  Mussels, frites, great beers, and a rotating selection of seasonal entrees and classic Belgian/ French food.
Fun brunch spot.
Food is decent. Ok brunch spot. The second time I went I ordered the Greek yogurt parfait and they just crushed up a nature valley bar into it. A little odd in my opinion.
First you pay 15$ for a simple Belgian beer. Then you learn it is the service folks to decide your tip... Avoid.
Good food. It was fun. The atmospheer was good.
Tuesday mussels specials and outdoor seating
Excellent food and service

We had high expectations in coming to the place. Message to the owner: if you put dishes in flemish be sure to educate your staff on what it is. And, it would be better if the waiters were a bit more jovial and not as pretentious as they are. Belgians typically are not pretentious 😏. Still some work but he, you are the boss.

My daughter & i recently visited the restaurant right after the 4th of july. There was next to no one in there , just a few people that were all caucasian . Before my daughter & i could get all the way through the door the waiter approached us & said “we have menus outside, are you sure you wanna come in & eat here” . So i responded “why does it look like we can’t afford to eat here ?”. Then he quickly acted like he didn’t mean it like that ( which he did) . All the tables were available except for one because the other few people that were there were at the bar. We asked if we could have a  table by the window & he told us no because that table wasn’t clean ... but the table he sat us at right by the door also wasn’t clean . The service did not get much better throughout our whole time there . Everything i tried to order, they were out of . This was our first experience there and it was awful.
Belga Cafe is usually pretty slow service and pretty pricey. They’re gin bar on the roof is definitely a more fun environment with better service!
Great World Cup watch party venue.
Good
Absolutely amazing. They exude excellent customer service
Consistently good.
Very very loud inside and has a bit difficult menu.

The food was very good, as were the drinks. The atmosphere and service, meh. The verdict is still out on that. So I felt like the atmosphere was a bit pretentious, and the staff appeared to cater to the needs of those individuals and not …

Although my father is continually stymied by the name of this cafe (oftentimes assuming the food is actually Bulgarian), the BELGIAN cuisine is extraordinary.  I've tasted waffles both savory and sweet here, as well as a rasher of bacon so crisp it could have been a stand-in for Samuel L Jackson in Unbreakable.  Don't waste your time with the predictable Ted's Bulletin when this gem is directly across the street.
Food was amazing. Our waiter was friendly and efficient. He joked with us and made us feel very welcome. A definite go to spot for a great brunch.
Ate brunch sitting at the bar with a friend. Crowded, but food was delicious!
Good food, good service but small space so hard to have a conversation over drinks and dinner

Solid brunch.  Food quality is always great. Lunch/dinner service feels a little overpriced and the menu isn't for everyone. Overall great restaurant. Ordered Thanksgiving meal from Belga Cafe two years in a row. Great deal for feeding a group of 4+ people.
(Translated by Google) Mussels and fries - hmmmmmm  (Original) Moule and frites - hmmmmmm

(Translated by Google) The steak was delicious also the Belgian fries that came with it. If you want to eat Belgian dishes in the US, the place to be. The server was also very friendly.  (Original) De steak was heerlijk ook de Belgische frietjes die er bij waren . Als je in de vs Belgisch gerechten wilt eten the place to be . De bediend was ook heel vriendelijk .

Very enjoyable visit, which was initiated by the visiting Belgians. They missed meeting the Belgian chef. The mussels were tasty but some seemed over done (I've been educated that the mussels need to be shaken 2-3 times during cooking to prevent overcooking). The Belgians need additional vegetables and 'mussel sauce' to be more to their liking. The stew was also order and found to be very tasty. Service was prompt and attentive (not too busy during our early dinner). Photo of Rodenbeck mussels w/asparagus.
Food is good but very pricey. Not the best place for a boozy brunch. No drink specials and bloody/mimosas will run you 10$ and up.
Incredible Belgian beer selection compliments the authentic dishes. The mussels are perfectly prepared in sauces that are outstanding.
This is one of my favorite spots on the Hill. Happy hour or brunch is awesome.  Lambic beer, mussels, and fries are a staple and tons of brunch options too.  Best Belgian waffles in the city IMO.
We were happy enough with the food. The service was really really slow. It seemed that the waiter was doing his best but could really have used some help.

Came for a large family dinner a few weeks ago and cannot say enough nice things about the staff!  We brought more people than planned and they accommodated us without fuss.  The waiter was attentive and had a great personality and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu.  The restaurant is small and quite loud, which is fine if you are dining with only one person across from you or next to you, but for a big group it was isolating.  I had the beef tartare appetizer, which was a large portion and very tasty, followed by the duck entree, which was good, but not amazing.  Most of the guests at my table had either steak or mussels and felt too that everything was very good, but not amazing especially for the price.  In summary, great service, good food, rather expensive for what you get so I'll give it 4 stars.
Great Bagels almost like New York...
One of the best brunches in the city.  Dinner is great too.
Food was so-so. Wine and beer list was great. Service was nice, but not exceptional.
Awesome brunch. Waffles are amazing.
One of the best places to eat in East Market. Glad I visited after eight years. Worth coming back for.
Belga is always delicious. Wait staff can be a bit temperamental.
Excellent food and service located near ground transportation in the heart of the city!
Food is good, and the service is great.
Food was just ok. Service and experience was just ok. To our opinion, overpriced for what you get.
Excellent onion soup and mussels

Went for Restaurant week. The place was packed. Best egg sandwich I have ever had, I believe it had black truffle in it. I'm not sure this is a year round item but it was amazing and the beer selection is just as good. The only thing I …
Very good food and atmosphere.. Good for Brunch
Love this place! They make a delicious Bloody Mary with a whipped celery topping 😊❤️

The food is exquisite. I went for brunch and had the mixed berries and the Eitjes & Gerookte Zalm (Belgian eggs Benedict). And it all came out much faster than I expected. But be warned, during brunch time, it's pretty crowded, but worth it
Good food but I was expecting a little more wow from the waffles.

Belga Cafe is a restaurant concept by Belgium native and award-winning Chef Bart Vandaele. A vibrant atmosphere modeled after Brussel's casual cafes, Belga Cafe is the original Belgian restaurant in Washington, DC. Opened in 2004, the neighborhood locale on Capitol Hill is known for its authentic cuisine, extensive craft beers and Genevers.  Serving, lunch, dinner, the ever popular brunch, and "Dinsdag Mossel," Belga Cafe features an open kitchen, European casual dining room along with a sidewalk cafe. It is a small piece of Brussels on the Hill.

Great food with Belgian beer on tap. Had the steak sandwich and a pint of Gulden Draak as well as sampled some excellent waffles. Visited Belgium last year and I would say this place easily reminds me of that great trip, from the food, atmosphere, to the beer, and the friendly folks working there.
Great Wine Selection.

(Translated by Google) Extensive menu of beers from around the world, each with its glass. The steack & frits the best!  (Original) Extensa carta de cervezas de todo el mundo, cada una con su vaso. El steack & frits lo mejor!

Some friends and I visited for lunch during restaurant week. The food was phenomenal and the service was great. I really appreciated that they opened nearly their whole menu to the restaurant week option.
Great place can be a little noisy and cramped but the waffles and poched eggs are awesome

I went with friends for restaurant week.  I ordered the escargot, cassoulet, and chocolate mousse.  Everything was delicious.  All my friends really enjoyed their meals too (first time all 7 of us liked everything).  Our waiter was Sam and he was fantastic...super friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend this place.
Heel lekker! The best moules frites I've had on this side of the Atlantic. The staff was very attentive. The food was delicious.
So yummy!
Not as good as it used to be
Good Belgian beer good mussels good Belgian food all on Capitol Hill don't miss it of course a little noisy

I would give 4 stars for the burger. However, the waiter who showed verbal aggression because a toddler in our group kept on playing with a box of sugar against his warning took most of those stars away. 2 stars instead of 1,  because the manager was kind enough to apologize in unacceptably rude waiter's stead.
Delicious but VERY overpriced!
A little overpriced IMO for what you get, but quality food and service overall.
It is an extremely authentic Belgian cuisine and a fine dining experience.
I lived in Belgium for 6 years. This is authentic food you would get at any decent Belgian restaurant.
Love the steak and fries...as good as ever!
Great beer list

The food is alright but definitely not worth the price it's being charged. The drinks we good were God awful. Their saving grace is that the staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is quite beautiful.
Very tasty Belgian cafe. Brunch was fabulous. Had eggs Benedict and a tasty chorizo hash. Names were in french. On point. Ambiance was average for price. Location outstanding in Capital Hill.
Perfect, don't say that a lot about restos in the US.
Absolutely the best mussels I've ever had!
Very nice service!
Excellent menus for both beer and dinner. Service was great, very attentive but not overbearing. Ambiance was very nice as well, subtle and upbeat music with an overall classy decor throughout.
Belgian eats and waffles with a great selection of beer and wine
Luv the mussels luv the belgian beer on tap. Whats not to luv??
Yummy brunch spot with unique waffle combinations!
Eat at the secret patio in the ball!
Really good food,but expensive. Very cool spot on the street. Very professional wait staff.

First time here, had brunch.  Food was very good, really liked the atmosphere.  There is outdoor seating, indoor and a lovely space upstairs.  Service was great, food yum ! ! !   Definitely going back.
Fair food and over priced drinks.
Really delicious well presented food
Loved the service and the food
Went for a super-early brunch Restaurant was full Their cornbread-pulled pork sandwich was delicious Reservations are recommended
Incredible food!  This is true, Belgian food: delicious, beautifully presented, and creative. A jewel of a restaurant.

We've been coming to Belga since it opened and love the authentic menu, the excellent beer (esp.) and wine menu, and the dedicated staff. We always have a great meal at Belga. Love the mussels, frites, many of the other fish and meat dishes (try the stew on a plate - yum!) and be good to your bartender.
This is a great Belgian cafe. I love their breakfast options and pick this restaurant over most of the others in the barracks row/eastern market area.  Give the waffle a try!
This is really amazing. It's like in a café somewhere in Brussels. The food is great and the drinks excellent.
Loved my time there, went with a food tour so I didn't get a chance to try much of the food, but the little I did try is worth a revisit with more food.
Delicious mussel dishes.
A small piece of Belgium in Washington and this is not a hell hole :-)
Loved the brunch menu. So many tasty choices equals return visit.
Amazing brunch
Great food and service. Lots of beer and wine selection.
The food is awesome, great environment and the noise level is nor overwhelming as in many restaurants.
Nice outdoor sitting area.  Food was beautifully presented. Tastes good but slightly too salty for me (waffle with duck). Quiche was very good. Service was ok and can be better.
Great happy hour.

I've never been impressed wit Belga Cafe. It's been around for years and I just can't fall in love with it. Here's what's NOT going for it (and what is):  What's not:  -The food: It just isn't amazing. The fries comes in small portions and …

Came here July 4th weekend and service was horrible. It took the waiter 15 mins to get us some menus. Afterward it took another 20 mins to get the food. I order a waffle and the waffle had the worst presentation. No powdered sugar, no whipped cream, no syrup and no butter! My husband had to get up from his seat and find the waiter to ask for some syrup and butter. The chefs in the kitchen make no exceptions  for dietary restrictions. My husband wanted to substitute pork for something else and the waiter said that the chef said no. Please stay away!

This place is popular, I would recommend getting a reservation for brunch. The food was good & yeah you're probably overpaying for what you get. The lychee mimosa was a bit of a let down, try the Bellini instead. Overall it's a nice place to meet up with friends and have some tasty waffles.
Frites! Great beer
Great spot for friends or families

I went for brunch on a Sunday around 12:30 with no reservation. Had no problem being seated! I ordered the Kaas Wafel Met Kwartel  (fried quail, aged cheddar waffle, sweet and spicy sauce) and it was phenomenal! I'll definitely come here for brunch again!
Breakfast dishes are good. The waffles are the main attraction ... nothing complex in flavors, just butter and whipped cream. Service is not good.
Great food and good service
This is one of my favorite brunch places when my family comes into DC.
Amazing beer selection. The mussel pot was DIVINE. Wife loved her steak. I'd come back here again and again.
